comment.author: 29877325@N07
comment._content: War is hell...so they say. But the picture is great, and evokes sad circumstances during a period of turmoil and war. This was/is a common practice among the military to collect the oponents souvenirs, hats, helmets, knives and even guns ( I think I see either a Luger 9mm or a Walther P38) . Nicely preserved photo !!!

comment.author: 27598097@N04
comment._content: yes...like the scene of the film ...really feel..

comment.author: 39549683@N00
comment._content: Battle of the Somme - september 1916? See frontlines: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Battle_of_the_Somme_1916_map.png. Or is this the so called second battle of the Somme - august / september 1918? The "first" seems the most probable. Thiepval today host a very impressive war memorial: http://www.flickr.com/search/?w=all&q=thiepval+memorial&m=text.

comment.author: 85909475@N00
comment._content:
I find your collection of photographs amazing,while the curse of war will never go away it is always interesting that we keep a record of the past wars for the younger generation so that maybe they will learn how stupid war is..
Congratulations on a wonderful collection..
